title: Energy of SHM- block spring maximum speed

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m equals 2.0 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant <math alttext="k equals 25 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>. The block is displaced a distance <math alttext="0.10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from equilibrium and released from rest, as shown. The block oscillates in simple harmonic motion. The maximum speed that the block obtains is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="1.3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.50 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.35 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.35</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.13 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.13</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.35 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.35</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
